Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2020/0676 b) Date of Occurrence: 03/01/2024
c) Installation Details: Wasp Interceptor - AC-5792-549 at
Maintenance Hub-X
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Pneumatic b) Date Component 12/01/2024
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Pressurization d) Main Assembly: Pylon-A
e) Nomenclature: Pressurization Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: MOD-A
g) Part No.: PN-8933-S6 h) Sl No.: SN-5081-123
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 08/10/2022 l) Date of Removal: 10/01/2024
Pg No: 138 Ln No: 17 Pg No: 70 Ln No: 12
m) Manufacturing Agency: Skyward Defense Systems n) Date, Month & Year October 2016
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: No p) Whether under AMC No
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 3441 Hrs / 1544 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Mission Critical
b) Defect Observed: Outflow valve control malfunction. Anomaly detected during routine inspection.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Vibration induced loosening of mechanical fasteners
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Pressurization component. Physical
examination revealed signs of wear and degradation.
c) Remedial Measures Adjust calibration settings to manufacturer specifications
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Modify design to incorporate additional safety margin
d) Attributable Code: D - Due to features inherent in the design
Remarks: Thorough investigation completed. Preventive actions recommended.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Investigation findings reviewed. Root cause analysis is acceptable. Recommend implementation of proposed corrective actions.
Date: 20/01/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Dr. P.L. Mehta

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Quality aspects reviewed. Manufacturing process controls are adequate. Recommend supplier quality audit.
Date: 23/01/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr V.K. Patel
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
User perspective considered. Recommend update to operating procedures based on lessons learned.
Date: 23/01/2024 Signature: Dr. P.L. Mehta
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Quality aspects from regulatory perspective reviewed. Investigation methodology is comprehensive and acceptable.
Date: 25/01/2024 Signature: Air Cmde S.B. Rao
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Design authority review completed. Recommend continued airworthiness monitoring of affected component type.
Date: 27/01/2024 Signature: Dr. A.K. Sharma
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
